title: Is North America's Arctic vulnerable to Russia?
description: As tensions with Russia rise, fears mount that North America's isolated Arctic may be vulnerable

title: Queen's delight as teapot factory comes to her
description: She was originally meant to visit the Staffordshire firm - but it arranged to bring its wares to Windsor.

title: Ukraine daily roundup: World leaders show united front at major summits
description: It was a busy day of international diplomacy on Thursday, with several emergency summits taking place.

title: England in West Indies: Jack Leach and Saqib Mahmood spare tourists' top order
description: Jack Leach and Saqib Mahmood are England's unlikely saviours after the tourists' top order collapsed on day one of the decisive third Test against West Indies.

title: War in Ukraine: What Ukraine is getting right
description: The BBC's Frank Gardner looks at four themes that have defined Ukraine's reaction to Russia's invasion.

title: Ukraine-Russia: The 76-year-old artist taking on Putin
description: "What's happening is a disgrace," says Elena, who was carried away by police for anti-war protests.

title: Quiz of the week: What did gamers do for Ukraine?
description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

title: Defiant Ukrainian troops tell Russians: 'Go home while you're still alive'
description: Quentin Sommerville and cameraman Darren Conway have spent time with two fighters since the very start.

title: Next warns prices to rise by more than expected
description: The clothing and homeware retailer increases its predicted price rises for the second half of 2022.

title: P&O Ferries: Not consulting on job cuts broke law, boss admits
description: Peter Hebblethwaite admits P&O should have consulted unions before sacking 800 ferry workers.

title: Netflix boss Scott Stuber says Oscar best picture win would be the dream
description: Ahead of the ceremony, executive Scott Stuber says it would be "terrible" if Netflix killed cinema.

title: Croydon tram crash: Prosecutions launched by rail regulator
description: Seven passengers died and 61 were injured when a tram derailed in south London in 2016.

title: Prince Harry: Parts of legal case to be kept secret, court says
description: The Duke of Sussex is challenging the government's decision to refuse him police security during visits.

title: Gordon Ramsay sends chef to help Biggleswade school canteen
description: Rob Roy Cameron served up school dinners after kitchen manager Tina Clarke made a plea on BBC Radio.

title: Child Q: Strip-search Met officers put on desk duties last week
description: The Met says officers who conducted a search of a black pupil left public-facing roles last week.

title: Fans descend on Cardiff as Wales seek to move step closer to ending 64-year World Cup wait
description: Wales are looking to take a step closer to their first football World Cup since 1958.

title: North Korea tests banned intercontinental missile
description: It is the first time such a missile, which puts the US within reach, has been tested since 2017.

title: Spring Statement: Rishi Sunak accused of not doing enough for poorest households
description: The chancellor's mini-Budget is under scrutiny, as Boris Johnson hints at more help for hard-pressed families.

title: Ukraine war: Dnipro orphans find sanctuary in Scotland
description: The children, who were evacuated from Dnipro, can stay in Scotland until it is safe to return home.

title: War in Ukraine: UK unveils new Russia sanctions as PM aims at gold reserves
description: The UK reveals more sanctions as Boris Johnson and other Nato leaders meet to discuss the war in Ukraine.

title: Russian warship destroyed in occupied port of Berdyansk, says Ukraine
description: Ukraine's navy says the Orsk, which was used to ferry Russian troops, was hit in Berdyansk.

title: David Amess killing: Suspect 'admitted terror crime to police'
description: A jury hears from the unarmed police officers who confronted the suspected killer of David Amess MP.

title: P&O boss Peter Hebblethwaite asked if he is a 'shameless criminal'
description: P&O Ferries chief executive Peter Hebblethwaite issues a "late apology" after the on-the-spot sacking of 800 staff.

title: Fit-again Scarratt in England team after 11-month gap for Six Nations opener
description: Centre Emily Scarratt will make her first England appearance in 11 months when the side begin their Women's Six Nations title defence in Scotland.

title: Sunderland's former England striker Defoe retires
description: Sunderland's former England, West Ham, Tottenham and Rangers striker Jermain Defoe retires from football at the age of 39.

title: Former Ballon d'Or winner Hegerberg ends five-year exile from Norway squad
description: Forward Ada Hegerberg is named in the Norway squad for the World Cup qualifiers against Kosovo and Poland in April.

title: Refugees in Wales: 'Thank God I came here after our home was bombed'
description: The family house was destroyed and they lived in a tent but now they've settled in rural Wales.

title: UFC fighter Masvidal charged by police after alleged altercation with Covington at restaurant
description: UFC fighter Jorge Masvidal is charged with felony battery by police in the US after an alleged altercation with rival Colby Covington outside a restaurant.

title: 'Our most complete performance yet' - England thrash Pakistan to close on World Cup semis
description: Impressive England sweep aside Pakistan to move closer to a place in the semi-finals of the Women's World Cup.

title: Prince William expresses 'profound sorrow' over slavery in Jamaica speech
description: The Duke of Cambridge condemns the slave trade, saying it "forever stains" the UK's history.

title: Goldman Sachs boss David Solomon set to DJ Lollapalooza
description: US investment banker David Solomon will play Lollapalooza in Chicago alongside acts like Metallica.

title: Orchards vanishing from the landscape, says National Trust
description: Orchards are in big decline, with an area the size of the Isle of Wight lost since 1900, research finds.

title: 'Shame on you': How President Zelensky uses speeches to get what he needs
description: In 10 parliaments over two weeks Ukraine's leader has used shame and national trauma to set a global agenda.

title: Small business owners: 'We're taking the hit'
description: Many entrepreneurs are struggling to balance soaring costs and keep their businesses profitable.

title: My Job: 'Covid has made it impossible to switch off'
description: Ed Kendall qualified as a social worker in 2019 and has started a role focusing on safeguarding.

title: The Ukrainian refugee who loves to laugh at school in Poland
description: Ten-year-old Yana started school in Poland three weeks ago, after fleeing the war in Ukraine.

title: Zimbabwe by-elections: New party, same fears of dirty tricks
description: A host of by-elections present a key test for the new opposition and the country's democratic credentials.

title: Ukraine war: Destruction of cities shown from above
description: In the month since Russia's military invaded, it has laid waste to cities across Ukraine.

title: Oscars 2022: Which film might be named fan favourite?
description: Cinderella, Minamata and Sing 2 might not be nominated, but they could be named "fan favourite".
